parameter.name: config_10_2
parameter.label: 10: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON / ALL OFF
parameter.description: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

options.option: ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Automatic turning off output after set time
parameter.description:
• 0 - Auto OFF disabled
  • 1 – 32536 = 1 second – 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second.

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Automatic turning on output after set time
parameter.description:
• 0 - Auto ON disabled
  • 1 – 32536 = 1 second – 32536 seconds Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second.

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Enable / Disable 3-way switch
parameter.description: Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1 (by default). Enabling 3way switch, dimming can be controlled by push button or switch connected to I1 and I2.

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Enable / Disable Double click function
parameter.description: If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value.

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Saving the state of the device after a power failure
parameter.description: If state saving is enabled, flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure). If state saving is disabled, flush dimmer module does not save the state after a powe

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Power reporting in watts on power change
parameter.description:
Set value means percentage, set value from 0 - 100 = 0% - 100%. Default value is 5.
  • 0 – Reporting Disabled
  • 1 – 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is sent (push) only when actual power in Watts in rea

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
parameter.description:
Set value means time interval (0 – 32767) in seconds, when power report is sent.
  • 0 – reporting disabled
  • 1 – 32767 = 1 second – 32767 seconds. Reporting enabled. Power report is sent with time interval set by ente

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: Minimum dimming value
parameter.description:
• 1-98 = 1% – 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming value is set by entered value.
NOTE: The minimum level may not be higher than the maximum level! 1% min. dimming value is defined by Z- Wave multilevel device class.

parameter.name: config_61_1
parameter.label: 61: Maximum dimming value
parameter.description:
• 2-99 = 2% – 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming value is set by entered value.
NOTE: The maximum level may not be lower than the minimum level! 99% max. dimming value is defined by Z- Wave multilevel device class.

parameter.name: config_65_2
parameter.label: 65: Dimming time (soft on/off)
parameter.description:
Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through UI (BasicSet).
  • default value 100 = 1s
  • 1 - 255 = 100 mseconds – 25500 mseconds (25.5

parameter.name: config_66_2
parameter.label: 66: Dimming time when key pressed
parameter.description:
Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continuous hold of push button I1 or associated device.
  • default value 3 = 3s
  • 1- 255 = 1 second – 255 seconds.

parameter.name: config_67_1
parameter.label: 67: Ignore start level
parameter.description: This parameter is used with association group 3. A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1.

parameter.name: config_68_1
parameter.label: 68: Dimming duration
parameter.description: This parameter is used with association group 3. The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value.

parameter.name: config_120_1
parameter.label: 120: Digital temperature sensor reporting
parameter.description:
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available configuration parameters:
  • default value 5 = 0.5°C
  • 0 – Reporting disabled
